page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY LANCING 1945
page.content: We interviewed Mr.Rickard who lives at 64 Pratten Avenue.He had some very interesting memories of Lancing around 1945.It was a lovely village between Worthing and Shoreham,with a population of about 9_11,000.Monks Recreation ground used to be a cabbage patch.There were only 4 postmen in the whole of Lancing at the time.There was a little shed behind the Merry Monk pub whitch used to be the post office but then it moved to where the Midland Bank is know.The police station was just a house with only two policemen.The sergeant was Mr.Willams and his wife was the midwife of Lancing.The only school in our block at the time was south Lancing.Lancing was the biggest village then and still is in England.It had lots of nurseries growing tomatoes,cauliflowers and carnations.
